db:abstract.db:para: The QDBusServer class provides peer-to-peer communication between processes on the same computer.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QDBusServer::QDBusServer(QObject *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QDBusServer with the given parent. The server will listen for connections in /tmp (on Unix systems) or on a TCP port bound to localhost (elsewhere).

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QDBusServer::QDBusServer(const QString &address, QObject *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QDBusServer with the given address, and the given parent.

db:section.db:title: QString QDBusServer::address() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the address this server is associated with.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] bool QDBusServer::isAnonymousAuthenticationAllowed() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if anonymous authentication is allowed.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: bool QDBusServer::isConnected() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this QDBusServer object is connected.
If it isn't connected, you need to call the constructor again.

db:section.db:title: QDBusError QDBusServer::lastError() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the last error that happened in this server.
This function is provided for low-level code.

db:section.db:title: void QDBusServer::newConnection(const QDBusConnection &connection)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when a new client connection connection is established to the server.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.3] void QDBusServer::setAnonymousAuthenticationAllowed(bool value)
db:section.db:para: If value is set to true, an incoming connection can proceed even if the connecting client is not authenticated as a user.
By default, this value is false.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.3.
